items.title: Solving the Excel problem by embracing it
items.summary: An all too common site, having engineers spend hours transcribing a SME's spreadsheet into scalable code. There must be an easier way, and I think it looks something like this: https://excelanalysis.herokuapp.com/ The context: people turn to spreadsheets to solve their day to day analytics. This is great because…
items.content_html:
An all too common site, having engineers spend hours transcribing a SME's spreadsheet into scalable code. There must be an easier way, and I think it looks something like this: https://excelanalysis.herokuapp.com/

The context: people turn to spreadsheets to solve their day to day analytics. This is great because excel offers great flexibility and fast iteration. These are the reasons business' depend on Excel.

The problem: day by day the spreadsheet grows.... one day finance wants a sheet for NPV inserted the next engineering want to assess a project feasibility. Your sheet gets sent around the whole organisation, everyone adding their own spin, their own logic. Some of these modifications make it back, some float around the organisation.

The outcome:

Thousands of slow spreadsheets, constantly breaking, "v101.3 B CB --change v1". We've all seen business decision based on spreadsheets like these. Often to codify the logic built up in these invaluable cells the business brings in expensive consultants who spend months codifying the sheet into Python, only for the business requirements to change a month after they leave, making the app redundant. This cycle seems to always lead back to Excel, and it's obvious to see why to anyone who've tried writing a simple python script to do what can be done in 5 seconds in Excel.

The solution:

We need to embrace the flexibility and pace of iteration offered by spreadsheets, not reinvent it. Something like my mock up gives business users a way to centralise their sheets, allows anyone to access it and speeds up the execution with horizontal scaling. By giving the SME these benefits we could fit version control over it (imagine a git commit every time someone uploads a sheet), and even implement global API's that reach into these sheets.

 

Excel has transformed the way we make decisions and fighting the human impulse to use this magnificent tool is a losing battle. Instead we should embrace it and enhance its shortcomings. We should enable faster development to keep the user engaged, while sneaking in wider business processes like version control. In the end the only tool worth building is one that will be loved and therefor used by the knowledge holders in the business.

items.content_html:
Exploiting where engineering promise meets business realities to create value for society

Working across multiple industries in Australia and South Africa, I have drawn on innovative techniques to improve business efficiency and support smooth technological integration into large legacy organisations.

I specialise in developing optimisation solutions for large asset management problems and designing fit for purpose change management frameworks for complex, dependency heavy initiatives. I have gained valuable cross industry experience working in different disciplines (mining, shipping, government and data analytics) nationally (Queensland) and internationally (Indonesia and South Africa). I have a particular focused on the improving organisations’ way of working through their digital initiatives.

EXPERIENCE

MANAGEMENT CONSULTANT

PwC / Deloitte

Leverage my experience to develop optimisation solutions for large asset management problems and to design fit for purpose change management frameworks for complex, dependency heavy initiatives.

Hill of Value

Oz Minerals

Hill of Value is an innovative mine planning method which focusses on 1-3 year planning, particularly before capital investment. My role was to assess use cases, build user personas and user requirements and explore business use casses.

I also built a demo application in Python to give the client interactivity with the Hill of Value idea.

https://www.ausimmbulletin.com/feature/the-role-of-mine-planning-in-high-performance/

Inventory analysis and dashboarding

Oz Minerals

Analyse the potential risk/reward assosiated with adjustments of various stock min/max levels in a mine spares setting.

Achiements

  • Tableau dashboarding
  • Tableau prep
  • Interfacing with SAP systems
  • Engageing with stakeholders at all levels (including supply superintendent)

DATA INTEGRATION

BUMA - Adaptive Planning

Design data requirements, colate/verify clients data and process into optimisation engine.

Achiements

  • Using Python to extract transform and load clients data into a custom built optimisation engine.
  • Scoping user requirements
  • Assisting client in extracting relevant data.

CONTAINER LINEAR OPTIMISATION

MERATUS

Develop software to pull clients data from various internal systems into a central repository to be displayed on a dashboard.
Achiements

  • REST API development
  • Python scripting, including compiling into an executable to be run as a Windows service

ITP BATTERY LIMITS

BHP

High level design of the Technology function's responsibilities and accountabilities across all BHP sites.
Achiements

  • Design, develop and roll out PowerQuery driven Excel sheet to automate the assignment of R&A's based of clients governance framework.
  • Engage with operational teams on 23 different sites across 3 continents to incorporate feedback.
  • Design comms plan to communicate new R&A's.

ESTABLISHMENT OF PMO

DEPARTMENT OF JOBS, TOURISM, SCIENCE AND INNOVATION

DAM STORAGE DATA FAILURE INVESTIGATION

Investigated various technical and cultural failures in that contributed to a inaccurate data management.

LONG TERM PLANNING SUPPORT

BHP IRON ORE

BHP's strategic planning platform supported by Enterprise Optimizer connected their SQL stack.
Achiements

  • Investigated SQL bugs.
  • Designed platform enhancements and delivered price estimates.
  • Worked with client to prioritise future enhancements.

VACATIONER

RENEWABLE ENERGY HOLDINGS

Africa's largest hydro electric tricity generation company.
Achiements

  • Data analysis to determine if generator were aging well based on collected temperature data.
  • Configure ICS to capture and retain more data.
  • Assisted in plant shutdown and generator inspection.

EDUCATION

CHARTERED FINANCIAL ANALYST COURSE

Level 1 Passed
 

MAJOR IN MECHANICAL ENGINEERING WITH A SECOND MAJOR IN ECONOMICS

UNIVERSITY OF WESTERN AUSTRALIA
